intro: Dombeya ambongensis f. bevazahensis, commonly known as the Bevazahena dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant features woody stems and lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
